Pre-Game Insights: Egypt's coach Hossam Hassan emphasized the importance of scoring an early goal and maintaining balance between attack and defense.
The team will need to be disciplined to counter Botswana, especially on their home ground.
Hassan's tactical plan focuses on quick transitions and utilizing the speed of Egypt's star players, particularly on the wings.
Key players Imam Ashour, Omar Marmoush, and Mostafa Mohamed are unavailable due to injury.
Experienced defender Ahmed Hegazy will miss the match due to personal reasons.
Hassan has opted to retain Hamdi Fathi and Rami Rabia in central defense.
The midfield trio of Mohamed Elneny, Marawan Attia, and Zizo will provide both defensive cover and attacking support.
The attack will feature a formidable trio of Mohamed Salah, Trezeguet, and Osama Faisal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held at Francistown Stadium in Botswana, which has a capacity of 26,000 spectators.
Others: Egypt currently leads the group with 3 points, tied with Mauritania on goal difference.
Botswana is in third place with no points.
